publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2700 Bruce Crawford: GM Crop Trials—That the Parliament believes that the GM crop trials, proposed for three farms in Aberdeenshire and Fife and announced by the Scottish Executive on 31 January 2002, should not proceed in the light of (a) the report by the Royal Society on 4 February 2002, (b) the study by English Nature revealing that genes from separate GM varieties can accumulate in plants that grow from seed spilled at harvest through a process known as "gene-stacking" and (c) the recent admission by the Executive that horizontal gene transfer from GM foods has taken place under laboratory conditions. Supported by: Fiona McLeod*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Christine Grahame*, Richard Lochhead*, Tricia Marwick*, Irene McGugan*, Michael Russell*, Stewart Stevenson*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, Alex Neil*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
